intro: Disparago rosea, commonly known as the pink tansy, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its aromatic foliage contains compounds that have been historically used in herbal remedies. Disparago rosea is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
